message_2:
To simplify the given rational expression, we can first factor out the common terms in both the numerator and the denominator.

Numerator: (3x² - 9xy)
Factor out 3x: 3x(x - 3y)

Denominator: (6x² - 12xy)
Factor out 6x: 6x(x - 2y)

Now, the rational expression becomes:

(3x(x - 3y)) / (6x(x - 2y))

We can now simplify by canceling out the common terms:

3x/6x = 1/2

So, the simplified rational expression is:

(1/2)(x - 3y) / (x - 2y)
